column4: that's not true, it will install many optional packages, some from non-standard repositories. it's not just a matter of installing all of gnome. it will put in all the codecs to play all video and music files/ play dvd's and a lot of other things. stuff that is kind of a ping to do manually

Oh, I'm aware of what it's *designed* to do...  but it assumes you're running Ubuntu with Gnome, and if you're not, it'll install everything it needs to get all its Gnomy bits working, which turns out to be a large portion of Gnome.
ahh, ok. i didn't feel like going through all the manual steps and used it on this kubuntu machine to get all the video codecs.
Indeed.  Me neither...  I don't really have the need for it, honestly.
